comments.author: Matt (No Meat Athlete)

As much as I love the lemon juice and oil, it's getting just a little boring.  And as a mustard lover, I think that might be just the thing to spice it up!

comments.author: Grace
comments.content: This recipe is not vegan! Dijon mustard has white sugar in it which is dyed with bones from cows.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Not dyed so much as filtered, but feel free to replace the white sugar with one of the natural brands that doesn't use bone char. Here's a good one: http://www.amazon.com/dp/B000E9WB8G/?tag=poeticlicen07-20 . In all cases, the recipes that I indicate are vegan or gluten-free require you to choose ingredients that meet your own precise definition and needs. Same goes for vegetarian - some vegetarians worry about rennet and some don't.
